content:
Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the world’s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving people’s ability to move – whether for work or play.
What we do: 
The Hardware Systems Integration Manager (ESS) for Energy Storage Systems (ESS) is responsible for the proactive integration efforts between the system components into the aircraft level for the prototype and production aircraft. The Hardware Systems Integration Manager (ESS) will own the CAD definitions, integration requirements, certification planning, and aircraft integration of the Energy Storage System. This role will work collaboratively with multiple disciplines across the company including airframe, propulsion systems, battery modules, high voltage and low voltage EWIS, test and certification, safety, and suppliers.
This position will be required to work on-site 5 days a week.
What you can do:

Lead the development of certifiable energy storage system and develop processes for integration and manufacturing of subcomponents
Responsible for defining systems requirements, performing system integration, developing test cases, support onsite/offsite testing and review test reports and data to supplement design decisions
Lead multifunctional teams across different sites to implement the architecture strategy
Coordinate the design and implement of the systems/subsystems for a certifiable high voltage energy storage system
Participate in gate reviews (PDR, SRR, CDR, etc.) with internal or external collaborators
Act as the point of contact for certification and integration matters
Facilitate meeting program timelines by ensuring required components are available for ESS team
May require up to 25% of domestic and international travel
Other duties as assigned

What you can contribute:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Physics, or Mathematics required; Master's degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Aerospace Engineering preferred
Minimum ten (10) years of experience in R&D environment preferred (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)
Minimum four (4) years of experience of OEM integration
Experience at creating and reviewing technical drawings and schematics, GD&T, and engineering specifications
Experience with aircraft systems
Hands-on experience with testing methodologies, requirements development, test execution and data acquisition
Working knowledge of RTCA documents DO-178 , DO-160 and DO-311A
Working knowledge of safety analyses and processes, including Advisory Circular 23.1309-1E, 20-184, SAE ARP 4761, and SAE ARP 4754A
Knowledge in FAR Part 23/25/27/29, ARP 4761/4754A, good understanding of DO-160/178/254 requirements and other aerospace regulations/processes/standards
Strong familiarity with CAD design, and the ability to do hand calculations and create/integrate CAD models
Experience in electric vehicle technology experience
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills, organizational skills and attention to detail
Must have the ability to multitask and be able to independently prioritize and accomplish work within time constraints
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with demanding timelines
Ability to work in an environment with frequent interruptions
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Knowledge of Atlassian software: JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, etc.

You may also be able to contribute:

Extensive experience integrating and testing complex, highly integrated systems preferred
Experience with Solidworks, NX, CATIA preferred
